channel.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
channel.description: I am wondering if there is a way I can make a command that gives them items only if they have the money to subtract from in their inventory. I want to use commands like ::arrows, ::barrages, etc. But I want it to take money from their inventory for the items. If they do not have the money it cannot work. Is that possible?

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

deathschaos9:

Replace it with playerHasItem

worked! tyvm!

Read full topic

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:10, topic:341608”]Guys it would be smarter to put the two conditions separate.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("buysomething")) { if (hasItemAmount(995, amount)) { deleteItem(995, amount); addItem(thatItem, itemAmount); } else { sM("You need SUCHANDSUCH amount of money before you can purchase this."); } }[/quote]

Error:
client.java:10002: cannot find symbol
symbol : method hasItemAmount(int,int)
location: class client
if (hasItemAmount(995, 3100000)) {

1 Error
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: A command that gives them something for the price of something?

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Guys it would be smarter to put the two conditions separate.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("buysomething")) { if (hasItemAmount(995, amount)) { deleteItem(995, amount); addItem(thatItem, itemAmount); } else { sM("You need SUCHANDSUCH amount of money before you can purchase this."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Impious Lols, post:8, topic:341608”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=438010.msg3219660#msg3219660 date=1275074765]

When I add command, it has 100 errors no where even close to that command. (Different command)

You forgot a bracket.

give us the code you put in. including the brackets

[/quote]

if(playerHasItem(995, 3100000) && (command.startsWith(“arrows”)) {
deleteItem(995, 3100000);
addItem(892, 1000);
}[/quote]try that i modified it

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:2, topic:341608”]if(playerHasItem(ITEM NEEDED TO SPAWN, AMOUNT) && (command.startsWith(“COMMAND NAME”)) {
deleteItem(ITEM NEEDED TO SPAWN, AMOUNT);
addItem(ITEM TO ADD, AMOUNT);
addItem(ITEM TO ADD, AMOUNT);
addItem(ITEM TO ADD, AMOUNT);
}

this command will see if the person has enough money for barrage runes[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: A command that gives them something for the price of something?

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:2, topic:341608”]if(playerHasItem(995, coins cost for barrage runes) && (command.startsWith(“barrages”) {
deleteItem(995, coins amount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
}

this command will see if the person has enough money for barrage runes[/quote]

So “if(playerHasItem(995, coins cost for barrage runes)” makes sure the player has the item needed and “deleteItem(995, coins amount)” deletes amount after it adds “addItem(itemID,itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);”?

I want to make sure I UNDERSTAND it. Not just use code.

Read full topic

item.title: A command that gives them something for the price of something?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

if(playerHasItem(995, coins cost for barrage runes) && (command.startsWith(“barrages”) {
deleteItem(995, coins amount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
addItem(itemID, itemAmount);
}

this command will see if the person has enough money for barrage runes
